ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This class taught me how to read and write in hindi. I also became more comfortable with speaking hindi.
I learned so much more about Hindi reading and writing as well as culture in general. The course was one of the best at Yale so far.
Learned to speak, read, and write Hindi.
I learned the Hindi script and how to read and write.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: At the start, the course a little too fast paced which made it quite stressful. I did like how we had the opportunity to correct our assignments and work together in class.
Strengths: Mansi ji is the best professor I've had at Yale and she truly cares about student outcomes. Nothing needs to be improved, she clearly knows how to teach an amazing course.
I liked how collaborative this course was. I do feel like some of the larger projects happened quite quickly but that might just be a result of the length of the semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes!! Mansi Ji is a great professor, and the class is engaging and a great way to learn Hindi, especially if you spoke it at home.
Yes, if you want to learn to read and write while also improving speech this is a good course for that.
Yes, if they want to learn Hindi and engage with the south asian culture more. This class provides true community from Mansi jis efforts.
Yes, very fun and collaborative and environment. You become very close with the class.
Yes, a great way for native speakers to learn more about Hindi!
